meanings.definition: Concealing one's true motives or feelings
meanings.sent1: She wore a dissembling smile to hide her disappointment.
meanings.sent2: His dissembling behavior made it hard to trust him.
meanings.sent3: The cat's dissembling purr fooled everyone into thinking she was innocent.
meanings.sent4: The dissembling clouds masked the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The dissembling mask he wore at the party fooled no one.

meanings.sent1: The dissembling student pretended to be sick to avoid the test.
meanings.sent2: Her dissembling tone gave away her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The dissembling actor's performance was so convincing, he fooled the audience.
meanings.sent4: His dissembling excuses could not cover up his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The dissembling politician's promises were empty and false.

meanings.definition: Disguising or hiding one's true intentions
meanings.sent1: The dissembling spy blended into the crowd to avoid detection.
meanings.sent2: Their dissembling actions revealed their ulterior motives.
meanings.sent3: The dissembling chameleon changed colors to hide from its predators.
meanings.sent4: The dissembling fog obscured the path ahead.
meanings.sent5: The dissembling smile on her face masked her true emotions.
